title: Lorraine Kelly extends break from ITV show as she's replaced by Fearne Cotton for a fourth week
text:
Lorraine Kelly extends break from ITV show as she's replaced by Fearne Cotton for a fourth week The Celebrity Juice host is taking over presenting duties for the first time Share Get celebs   Could   
Fearne Cotton will present ITV ’s Lorraine for a week from Monday 13th March. 
The Celebrity Juice star, and former Radio 1 DJ, will front the programme while Lorraine Kelly enjoys a special trip to the Antarctic following in the footsteps of her hero, Sir Ernest Shackleton to mark her 25th wedding anniversary. 
It will be the first time that Fearne will present the ITV Daytime show, and she's really excited about interviewing the likes of Steps, Emma Watson and Tom Daley. 
She said: “It’s going to be such a fun week, I’m really looking forward to hosting the show while Lorraine enjoys her trip of her lifetime.” Read More Lorraine has extended her holiday in the Antarctic (Photo: ITV) (Photo: Rex Features) She's been on the show as a guest but never as a presenter (Photo: Rex Features) 
Lorraine Editor, Sue Walton, added: “I’m delighted that Fearne, such a popular and versatile broadcaster, is presenting the show for a week. 
"Fearne thrives on live, and her natural empathy, spontaneity, not forgetting her sense of fun will all shine through in what will be a special week of shows.” 
Lorraine was originally only going on holiday for three weeks - and had been replaced by Helen Skelton for one week, and Christine Lampard for the following two. 
At the time her trip was announced, she said: "I’m so excited for what will definitely be a trip of a lifetime and I feel very reassured to know that the show is in such safe hands while I’m away. Read More Lorraine Kelly strips off for an icy swim (Photo: ITV) Fearne is really excited to take over for the week (Photo: Rex Features) 
“I’ll be keeping in touch from Antarctica throughout my journey and I look forward to sharing my adventure with Lorraine viewers when I get back!” 
And Lorraine kept her promise when she stripped off for a freezing cold swim in -29°C Antarctic waters. 
The presenter is away with husband Steve Smith to celebrate their milestone, and she couldn't resist a swim in the icy conditions. 
*Lorraine continues on ITV1 weekdays at 9.25am Like us on Facebook
